alert.note: Alert for Cheshire; Sullivan (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 17 at 9:35AM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 130 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central and southern New Hampshire, including the following counties, in central New Hampshire, Sullivan. In southern New Hampshire, Cheshire. * WHEN...Until 130 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 932 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to slow moving showers and thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Keene, Dublin, Harrisville, Nelson, Marlow, Sullivan, Gilsum, Stoddard, Alstead and Roxbury.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
